timeline_data.body:
Issue Number: 20412
Status: Open
Recommended Components: comp:gc, comp:vm, comp:test
Recommended Assignees: pshipton, fengxue-is, jasonfengj9

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

timeline_data.body: @mpirvu @cjjdespres not sure if this is related to https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/issues/20239?
@cjjdespres Please grind that test with and without disclaiming enabled.

The grinders are in progress. This test was on `mac`, though, so I don't think we will have tried to allocate file-backed memory because of disclaiming. My omr changes were in `port/linux/omrvmem.c` and the code in the data cache and IProfiler in `openj9` that changes the flags for memory allocation for disclaiming is guarded by `ifdef LINUX`.

The cause could be similar. There are a few places that use `ftruncate`, including through `JVM_SetLength` and also `file_set_length` in the omr port library. Some of those uses are correct, because the underlying file is in memory, but maybe some aren't.

The man pages for functions like [`shm_open()`](https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man3/shm_open.3.html) say that `ftruncate` is the function to use for in-memory files, at least. It would be unfortunate if even there it didn't guarantee that enough space is available. I didn't think that `fallocate` would work with such files because its page says that it "is used to manipulate the allocated disk space for a file", but I haven't tested that assumption.

I'm not sure of this interaction, but if the underlying file space for the `mmap()` memory is allocated on-demand, perhaps something tried to read from an address that's within that memory but beyond any writes that have occurred. I think that would result in a bus error and not a segmentation fault.

There are some unhandled exceptions (bus error and segmentation error) mixed in the output.
I think the following is the register dump of the bus error, based on the InaccessibleAddress:

```
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.565Z] HHLT stderr Unhandled exception
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.565Z] HHLT stderr Type=Bus error vmState=0x00000000
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.565Z] HHLT stderr J9Generic_Signal_Number=00000028 Signal_Number=0000000a Error_Value=00000000 Signal_Code=00000001
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.565Z] HHLT stderr Handler1=000000010123B00C Handler2=0000000100EBDE50 InaccessibleAddress=0000003034333073

[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr x0=00000001439CB500 x1=000000017004A7C8 x2=0000000365D1EF88 x3=0000000365D1EF88
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr x4=000000017004A7D8 x5=000000017004A7C0 x6=000000017004A7B8 x7=000000017004A820
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr x8=000000303433306B x9=0000000280558760 x10=000000017004A7C0 x11=000000017004A7C8
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr x12=000000017004A7D8 x13=000000017004A7B0 x14=0000000101284764 x15=0000000000000010
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr x16=00000001012841D0 x17=00000001E3CD7738 x18=000000017004A101 x19=0000000040000000
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr x20=000000303433304B x21=000000017004A7B0 x22=0000000110C224F8 x23=000000017004A7C0
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr x24=000000017004A7D8 x25=000000017004A7C8 x26=000000017004A7C0 x27=000000017004A7B8
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr x28=000000010135AE34 x29(FP)=000000017004A7A0 x30(LR)=00000001012841C4 x31(SP)=000000017004A520
[2024-10-25T00:06:12.566Z] HHLT stderr PC=0000000101298C88 SP=000000017004A520
```

I can see the following instructions around the address pointed by the PC:

```
    0x101298c68: 0xf9400360   unknown     ldr    x0, [x27]
    0x101298c6c: 0xf9400408   unknown     ldr    x8, [x0, #0x8]
    0x101298c70: 0xaa1903e1   unknown     mov    x1, x25
    0x101298c74: 0xaa1a03e5   unknown     mov    x5, x26
    0x101298c78: 0xf94027e4   unknown     ldr    x4, [sp, #0x48]
    0x101298c7c: 0xf9402fe7   unknown     ldr    x7, [sp, #0x58]
    0x101298c80: 0xf9481908   unknown     ldr    x8, [x8, #0x1030]
    0x101298c84: 0x8b140108   unknown     add    x8, x8, x20
    0x101298c88: 0xf9400508   unknown     ldr    x8, [x8, #0x8] <- PC points here
    0x101298c8c: 0xf94002a9   unknown     ldr    x9, [x21]
```

Register x8 has the value 0x303433306B in the register dump, and x8+8 is the same as the InaccessibleAddress.  The core file does not contain the address.

```
(lldb) x/8x 0x0303433306B
error: core file does not contain 0x303433306b
```
The failure from Grinder looks much like a known issue with HeapHogLoadTest on AArch64 macOS: #19081
